whatIsPPFSection.heading: What Is a PPF (Public Provident Fund)?
paragraphs: The Public Provident Fund (PPF) is a long-term savings scheme introduced by the Government of India under the Public Provident Fund Act, 1968.
It encourages citizens to save regularly while enjoying a combination of fixed interest and tax-free returns.
Anyone can open a PPF account ‚Äî salaried employees, self-employed individuals, parents saving for their children, or even non-working individuals.

faqs.q: What is the Public Provident Fund (PPF)?
faqs.a: PPF is a long-term, government-backed savings scheme in India that offers a safe way to build a retirement/long-term corpus with tax-free interest and maturity proceeds.

faqs.q: Who can open a PPF account?
faqs.a: Any Indian citizen can open a PPF account. A parent or guardian can open and operate a PPF account on behalf of a minor. (Non-resident Indians cannot open fresh PPF accounts.)

faqs.q: What is the minimum and maximum I can deposit in a financial year?
faqs.a: The minimum annual deposit required is ‚Çπ500 and the maximum allowable deposit is ‚Çπ1,50,000 per financial year. Deposits can be made in lump sum or installments during the year.

faqs.q: What is the PPF lock-in period and can it be extended?
faqs.a: The standard lock-in period is 15 years. After maturity (15 years) the account can be extended in blocks of 5 years repeatedly.

faqs.q: How is PPF interest set and how often is it credited?
faqs.a: The Government reviews and notifies the PPF interest rate quarterly. Interest is compounded annually and credited at the end of the financial year.

faqs.q: Can I withdraw money before 15 years?
faqs.a: Partial withdrawals are permitted from the 7th financial year onward (subject to limits). Full withdrawal is normally allowed after the 15-year maturity.

faqs.q: Can I take a loan against my PPF balance?
faqs.a: Yes ‚Äî a loan facility is available generally between the 3rd and 6th financial years of the account, subject to prescribed limits and rules.

faqs.q: Are PPF contributions and returns taxable?
faqs.a: PPF enjoys EEE status: contributions are eligible for deduction under Section 80C (within limits), the interest earned is tax-exempt, and maturity proceeds are tax-free.
